intro: Cyrtandra eminens, commonly known as the highland cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations, often on forested slopes. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cyrtandra eminens plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
